Chapter:
The package
??? is a package which does some interesting and cool things. To be continued...
Framework
true or false
Groups acting on regular rooted trees are stored together with their degree (), depth () and other attributes in this category. See also . See also .
gap> G:=SymmetricGroup(3); Sym( [ 1 .. 3 ] ) gap> IsRegularRootedTreeGroup(G); false gap> H:=RegularRootedTreeGroup(3,1,SymmetricGroup(3)); Sym( [ 1 .. 3 ] ) gap> IsRegularRootedTreeGroup(H); true
the regular rooted tree group G as an object of the category .
The arguments of this method are a degree k \in\mathbb{N}_{\ge 2}, a depth n \in\mathbb{N} and a subgroup G of \mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,n}).
to do
the degree k of the regular rooted tree that G is acting on.
The argument of this attribute is a regular rooted tree group G \le\mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,k}) ().
to do
the depth n of the regular rooted tree that G is acting on.
The argument of this attribute is a regular rooted tree group G \le\mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,k}) ().
to do
the regular rooted tree group that arises from G by restricting to T_{k,n-1}.
The argument of this attribute is a regular rooted tree group G \le\mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,k}) ().
gap> G:=AutT(2,4); <permutation group of size 32768 with 15 generators> gap> ParentGroup(G)=AutT(2,3); true
true, if G is self-replicating, and false otherwise.
The argument of this attribute is a regular rooted tree group G \le\mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,k}) ().
gap> G:=AutT(2,2); Group([ (1,2), (3,4), (1,3)(2,4) ]) gap> subgroups:=AllSubgroups(G);; gap> Apply(subgroups,H->RegularRootedTreeGroup(2,2,H)); gap> for H in subgroups do Print(IsSelfReplicating(H),"\n"); od; false false false false false false false true true true
true, if G has sufficient rigid automorphisms, and false otherwise.
The argument of this attribute is a regular rooted tree group G \le\mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,k}) ().
to do
a regular rooted tree group which is conjugate to G in \mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,n}) and which has sufficient rigid automorphisms, i.e. it satisfies . This returned group is G itself, if G already has sufficient rigid automorphisms. Furthermore, the returned group has the same parent group as G if the parent group of G has sufficient rigid automorphisms.
The argument of this attribute is a regular rooted tree group G \le\mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,k}) (), which is self-replicating ().
to do
the regular rooted tree group M(G)\le\mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,n}) which is the unique maximal self-replicating extension of G to T_{k,n+1}.
The argument of this attribute is a regular rooted tree group G \le\mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,k}) (), which is self-replicating () and has sufficient rigid automorphisms ().
to do
a list \mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,n+1}-conjugacy class representatives of regular rooted tree groups which are self-replicating, have sufficient rigid automorphisms and whose parent group is G.
The argument of this attribute is a regular rooted tree group G \le\mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,k}) (), which is self-replicating () and has sufficient rigid automorphisms ().
to do
a list \mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,n+1}-conjugacy class representatives of regular rooted tree groups which are self-replicating, have sufficient rigid automorphisms and whose parent group is conjugate to G.
The argument of this attribute is a regular rooted tree group G \le\mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,k}) (), which is self-replicating () and has sufficient rigid automorphisms ().
to do
Auxiliary methods
This section explains the methods of this package.
n/a. This method removes G-conjugates from the mutable list subgroups.
The arguments of this method are a group G and a mutable list subgroups of subgroups of G.
gap> G:=SymmetricGroup(3); Sym( [ 1 .. 3 ] ) gap> subgroups:=[Group((1,2)),Group((2,3))]; [ Group([ (1,2) ]), Group([ (2,3) ]) ] gap> RemoveConjugates(G,subgroups); gap> subgroups; [ Group([ (1,2) ]) ]
the regular rooted tree group \mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,n}) () as a permutation group of the k^{n} leaves of T_{k,n}.
The arguments of this method are a degree k \in\mathbb{N}_{\ge 2} and a depth n \in\mathbb{N}.
gap> G:=AutT(2,2); Group([ (1,2), (3,4), (1,3)(2,4) ]) gap> RegularRootedTreeGroupDegree(G); 2 gap> RegularRootedTreeGroupDepth(G); 2
the regular rooted tree group \mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,n}) as a permutation group of the k^{n} leaves of T_{k,n}.
The arguments of this method are a degree k \in\mathbb{N}_{\ge 2} and a depth n \in\mathbb{N}.
gap> G:=AutT(2,2); Group([ (1,2), (3,4), (1,3)(2,4) ]) gap> a:=Random(G); (1,3,2,4) gap> BelowAction(2,2,a,1); () gap> BelowAction(2,2,a,2); (1,2)
